p: Gentiana asclepiadea L., Willow gentian, native to mountains of Central and Southern Europe, is 1 of 11 gentian species present in Serbian flora [ 3]. It mostly occurs at high altitudes approaching the subalpine belt, at mountain ores, wet meadows, peat bogs, light forests, and forest edges, and is most frequently found in spruce forests. Perennial species (15â€“60 cm high) blooming from July to September are characterized by the strong, thick rhizome that is used as a traditional remedy for hepatitis infections and digestive problems [ 4].
